item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Yeah, writing the code to handle GC’s API was a proper mindfuck, charged and refunded my card about 50 times >_>

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:317514”][quote author=Peeter link=topic=414031.msg3048300#msg3048300 date=1259934081]
Good idea with the exception of using paypal.

Brace for charge-backs on accounts that get banned for autoing / subscription card scamming (sell the card and then charge it back).

Also, yes I know you weren’t around for RSCD but they had the paypal subscription system and the API implementation was complete there.
[/quote]

Yeah I knew about PayPal being used on RSCD, everyone who uses subscriptions currently uses the same script (bar RSCA obviously). However, you can now save your button on PayPal so you don’t have to define prices and other options (and then do checks afterwards that they’re the right price) so I used it as an excuse to write it from scratch as I’ve never worked with PayPal’s API before.

I’m also a bit worried about PayPal but I when I looked at Google Checkout their API seemed even harder so I took the easier route (for now).

The card system does however check to see it’s a valid subscription before processing it. For example, I couldn’t spawn a Subscription Card and then use it. We’ll see how it goes I guess. Is Google Checkout pretty much flawless? People can’t change back?[/quote]

Charge-backs are handled by banks, once you have the money it stays your money. And as for Googles API being hard, you have no idea. Took Ollie like 2 weeks to figure it out. IMO all Google APIs are generally unnecessarily complicated or use 3rd party add-ons to simplify them.

Read full topic

Also, yes I know you weren’t around for RSCD but they had the paypal subscription system and the API implementation was complete there.
